alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 16 at 6:37PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Light to possibly moderate snow. Accumulations around 1 inch expected. Snowfall of 2 to 4 inches in the Nowood Valley south of Ten Sleep and in the mountains around Wind River Canyon. North wind gusting 25 to 35 mph will lead to blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Southern portions of the Bighorn Basin and the Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains. * WHEN...9 PM Wednesday to 12 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on roadways will be impacted by winter driving conditions and lowered visibility at times tonight into Thursday morning. Blowing and drifting snow will occur.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
